data.event: Grant County was established on October 14, 1864, from parts of old Wasco and old Umatilla counties.

event.title: 1889, more than half of the southern part of the original Grant County was taken

data.event: In 1889, more than half of the southern part of the original Grant County was taken to form Harney County.

event.title: 1899, a small part of northwestern Grant County was taken

data.event: Also in 1899, a small part of northwestern Grant County was taken (along with parts of Crook and Gilliam counties) to form Wheeler County.
